Data¶

src.data.data_processing.check_nan(dataframe, logger)[source]¶

Check NaNs

Check if the input dataframe contains NaN values and fill with 0

Parameters

  • dataframe – Data Frame if input data

  • logger – logger to record exception

Returns

output dataframe with 0 values in NaN values

Load Configuration Info

Load configuration info

Parameters

path – path of the config.ini file

Returns

dictionary with config data

src.data.data_processing.load_data(path, logger)[source]¶

Load input data

Load the crimes input data

Parameters

  • path (str) – path of the csv file to upload

  • logger – logger to record exception

Returns

dataframe with the data

src.utils.utils.get_frequencies(df, column, logger)[source]¶

Get frequencies

Obtain some distribution of frequency to known how is distributed the incidences

Parameters

  • df – Data frame

  • column – Column to obtain the distribution of frequency of occurrence

  • logger – logger to record exception

Returns

dataframe with the crimes frequencies

src.utils.utils.plot_barplot(df, var_x, var_y, path, logger)[source]¶

Plot Barplot

Plot a barplot to compare the incidence of crimes according to characteristics

Parameters

  • df – Dataframe to plot

  • var_x – x-axis variable

  • var_y – y-axis variable

  • path – path where it is saved plot in png format

  • logger – logger to record exception

src.utils.utils.plot_scatterplot(df, var_x, var_y, scale, path, logger)[source]¶

Plot scatter

plot with the coordinates of the crimes

Parameters

  • df – Dataframe to plot

  • var_x – x-axis variable

  • var_y – y-axis variable

  • scale – scale of the point

  • path – path where it is saved plot in png format

src.utils.utils.set_up_logger(path)[source]¶

Set up logger

Configure the logger to record all the events in the execution of the code

Parameters

  • path (str) – path where to store reports example: ‘reportslog_file_name’

  • logger – logger to record exception

Returns

logger logger
